basic_info.name: High School of Economics and Finance (02M489)

descriptions: We offer a rigorous academic opportunities for all students through our new ESTEEM program, combining economics, science, technology, engineering, entrepreneurship and mathematics. This includes many Advanced Placement (AP),  CUNY College Now courses and dual enrollment college courses in all subject areas. Our diverse, welcoming community extends beyond our doors to corporate and community partners, including Trinity Commons. Students have opportunities for job shadowing, internships and mentoring. Our full-time college advisement staff coordinates the college admissions process to make sure all of our students are being accepted to choice colleges. Students find enrichment in various athletics, civic, artistic, computer science and cultural programs and have access to our state-of-the-art library and technology center.

The NYC School Survey is administered every year to students in grades 6-12 and to families and teachers of children in grades K-12. The survey is designed to collect information about each school's ability to support student success.

Response rates show what percentage of the school community actually completed the survey. Higher response rates tell us that the results of the survey reflect the views of a larger portion of the group surveyed.
